The Dark Ranger (Ranger 35 / Monk 3 / Assassin 2)

Simple idea with a dex elven ranger:

Ranger 35 for high favored enemy damage, 10 favored enemies
Monk 3 for Monk UBAB (6-10 APR), Evasion, Monk Speed, Tumble 40
Assassin 2 for Uncanny Dodge, UMD, a little sneak

Damage with a Kama is 1d6 +8 +2d6 +2-8[Str] / hit +1d6 sneak against favored enemies = 14 to 40 damage / hit = 138 to 392 damage / round with 10 APR with mundane kamas.
With ITWF Mundane dual Kamas, Base Melee AB is 44 against favored enemies, 42 against non favored enemies. Ranged AB 43 favored / 41 non-favored

aluka's Evil Hunter has the same split but doesn't take feats I like (such as knockdown)
Skill split is for a modified 6 skill point / lvl for rangers, in vanilla NWN environments where rangers get 4 skill points / lvl, one will have to subtract 74 skill points (from search, spot and spellcraft).
20% exp penalty level 7 to 40 as an elf, one can avoid penalties as a human. Monk Speed, Uncanny Dodge, UMD do come a bit late.
